intro: Paralbizzia turgida, commonly known as the swollen lily, is a striking plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink, often with a velvety texture. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Its unique botanical traits include a fibrous root system and a woody stem that becomes more pronounced with age. Paralbizzia turgida is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
